name: Amaris Hotel Teuku Umar
address: Jl. Teuku Umar No.139, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1: Upon arrival, we were greeted kindly by employees, ordered 2 rooms for 1 night but 1 room had a jammed door when opened, but the staffs were quick to handle it. Expected to get one bed, but both of the rooms were twin bed instead. The room is quite cramped to invite children. There is no water heater, tea and coffee in the room, only mineral water, but mineral water refills are provided in the corridor. The swimming pool is great. Overall, the facilities match the price.
review 2:
The employer is good, very polite location good,but how the house keeping set up the cabin/room for new guest is very slow more then 30 menit for 1 room we was there waiting for cabin ready from 2 pm until 3 pm that time for 3 room we asking for next one cabin desk tell me 30 menit, we waiting but more then, bathroom alot melldiew, silicon must be change, ac not cold and water driping from the ac, i think amaris need management operasional for maintance.
Hopelly soon getting better
review 3:
Ok hotel for stay

They will provide two water bottles,
Toiletries , towels ,Twin bed system

Card payment available.

Free coffee at reception counter

Washroom is ok. It has shower

Two wheelers parking available

In center of kuta city

Unlimited breakfast is available
review 4:
(+),
- Value for money, best rate, strategic location
- Signature hospitality at all sector, from frontdesk to cleaning service
- Housekeeping and cleanliness
- Complete hotel amenities pack

(-),
- Poor in-room wifi signal and tv channel, on and off, unstable.
- Lack of maintenance as some equipments have broken, lift button, bathroom exhaust fan, shower tap, aircon remote censor, window blind, etc.
review 5:
The hotel is clean and tidy. The toilet is a little bit dirty especially the brown spot inside the toilet. No heater, no coffee, no tea in the room yet 2 bottles of water. Clean towels. And the breakfast is quiet limited. The staffs served it for us. But you got what you paid. Good for business trip tho.

The bed was nice, AC was perfect. Clean and comfortable to sleep.

I took around almost 10 mins for checkin and 5mins for check out. The seat for waiting is far from front desk. I'm not really convinient to sit down and go back and forth.

But overall the staffs were pretty friendly.

name: City of Aventus Hotel - Denpasar
address: Jl. Teuku Umar No.74, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1: We spent one evening here at the end of our trip where we were in northern Bali.  Our flight was the next morning, so we made the trip the day before.  We were able to arrange two different airport transfers through the hotel as we had two different departure times.  Check-in, shuttle arrangements, and dining options at the hotel were great.  It is very clean, and we could hear some work being done when we were at the restaurant, but our room was silent.
review 2:
Good deal
Its a new hotel, so everything here looks brand new.
- Spacious parking lot, valet available
- The staff..., they're all very helpful and kind
- The room..., i say its enough for 2 people.
Not recommend for an extra bed
- Haven't try the food cause we bought room
only
- Small swimming pool and small gym
- The bar..., they don't sell alcohol
- There's no kids corner
- Vehicle is a must, if you don't have any
vehicle you will be stranded here
- until this review is written, they have
electric bike for rent

The only minus here is the location. It is located in the center of Denpasar business district. So you won't find any tourist attraction or comfort food. The only convenient store is circle K which located about 50 meters for the hotel.
If you're in Bali for business travel, i highly recommend this hotel.

Over all, i recommend this hotel for stay. And i will definetly come back to stay at this hotel again in the future
review 3: A brand new hotel, good location in the city centre and Easy to varities of food. Except that the room wall is not soundproof that you can hear the noise in the adjacent room. My bathroom also have some design issue on the level of flooring as the higher drainage level causing flood, swimming pool like, haha! Otherwise the Staff service is very good, a minimalist and modern hotel.
review 4: My recent stay at this hotel was disappointing and far from the standards one could expect from this establishment. A room which, despite its promise of comfort, was tiny and far from clean. Stains on the sheets and hairs indicating a blatant lack of cleanliness in the room while using the shower, the door seal fell on me, an incident that was not only unpleasant but also indicative of the lack of maintenance of the facilities. In addition, the cleanliness of the bathroom left much to be desired. Added to this, the sound insulation of the rooms was almost non-existent, making my stay even more uncomfortable due to the constant noise. I reported all these issues to reception, hoping that action would be taken to improve my situation. Unfortunately, my request went unanswered, and no effort was made to remedy these inconveniences. This lack of responsiveness and customer service is unacceptable for a hotel that claims to be four stars. In conclusion, I cannot recommend this hotel, because it clearly does not meet the legitimate expectations of its customers.
review 5: Super hotel, I recommend it! Very nice hotel with beautiful rooms. Very clean! Big plus for the staff, who are very friendly and attentive. The hotel restaurant is very good. Very well located in the city! For a stay in Denpasar I highly recommend this place!

name: Choice Stay Hotel Denpasar
address: Jalan Pulau Kawe No. 40, Dauh Puri Klod, Denpasar Barat, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia
review 1: Strategic location, easy booking through whatsapp, helpful staff. We stayed for 6 nights and the room was spacey and clean. Didn‚Äôt try the pool. Many food stalls nearby, easy to find breakfast
review 2: For a one night stay, it was okay. A lot needs to be improved, especially the cleanliness. Not to mention the mezzanine stairs that are slippery. The place is just okay.
review 3:
Friendly staff. Access to pool from balcony.. Free wifi. Clean room
Alot of eateries nearby. No gym
review 4:
Nice, little and cozy hotel in the middle of dempasar.
Reception very attentive and polite, clean room facing the swimming pool on a 3 floors building.

No elevator and not too much choice for breakfast unfortunately.
review 5: I stayed in this hotel in March, as I wanted to get a closer walk to Simpang Enam to watch the Ogoh Ogoh Parade during Nyepi holiday. The hotel is standard for a three star hotel, the service is great and the food is good. I loved the big room and the small pantry which is quite suitable for families with kids. Some tiny part of the bathroom might need a bit of repair, but overall it is quite clean and acceptable for me. The location is quite strategic, although it is not on the main road, or at the main tourist area, but there are plenty of convenience stores and restaurants within walking distance. I enjoyed my stay there and got the bonus view, since on my way back to the hotel I met these group of kids carrying Ogoh Ogoh and they were heading to Simpang Enam. Overall, it is a pleasant experience to spend Nyepi vacations in Denpasar.

name: Link Costel
address: Jl. Pulau Sayang No.9B, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia
review 1: Really worst experience in Bali, the reality not expected as in the photo. We stay at the room 12. The bathroom was stinks and really creepy. Room also messed up, found 2 dead cockroaches behind the doors
review 2:
The female receptionist could have bit friendly. Room there's no windows so its very dark, humid, moldy, furniture is old, bed is broken, sheets are dirty, tv only 3 local channel that works, bathroom is not clean, hot water is not stable, so when you shower every 3 seconds you could have realllyy hot water and reallly cold water.
The receptionist guy at night is friendly and helpful.
Overall for 2 nights I regret staying here. There's better place for this price.
review 3: Location is okay, room was super dirty, dirtiest place I've ever stay. The ac unit is very noisy too. I checked out 1 day earlier because of it. People who stays here are loud, not recommended for kids, Or anything. Just avoid this place if you can.
review 4:
Affordable price, clean room
Excellent location
Parking lot available
Recommended transit hotel
review 5:
Fine hotel with low cost..
Everything okey except on the bathroom was stinky..

name: SAS - Soto Ayam Surabaya
address: Jl. Teuku Umar No.200, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia
review 1: The food here is OK. It used to be really nice and hot when served. The quality of the soto has gone down. We had the chicken too, it was spicy (which was good) but it came to us cold too. Good place for a fast, essential meal but nothing more than that.
review 2:
Easily one of the best warung soto in Denpasar. I have such a weak spot for Soto Lamongan especially the one who serve it with koya and lime on the side, chef's kiss.

The broth is flavourful and on the savory side, just the way I like it . The portion is just right and they have many condiments to choose from the menu. The price is competitive, but not expensive. Overall they have ticked all the right boxes. Definitely must try.
review 3: Lovely this Place. 1st time visiting . Delicious Soto Ayam and not forgetting the grilled chicken dish
review 4: Cleanest soto place I've ever been! They sell ayam bakar/goreng too besides soto and the bakar one is a bit spicy. It's probably I live in Jogja so I find the food a bit pricey to my liking but the taste is totally worth the price!
review 5: Popular eating place serving soto ayam. They do have add ons like friend chicken etc. Quick service and plenty of parking.

name: GET UP BALI
address: Jl. Teuku Umar No.143, Dauh Puri Klod, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1: One of the best and iconic lifestyle entertainment in Denpasar area, you should come !!
review 2:
The bar is dead inside, there are more staff than customers. Drinks are terrible. My G&T tasted like lime soda water, I barely tasted any gin inside. Wanted to have Hendricks as my base but they only do Gordon. Unsure of the logic behind that, you could've charged me for a single Hendricks and mixers.
Their Negroni tasted like disappointment, the bases are all rough and cheap, not even close to how the real Negroni was supposed to taste. Couldn't even bring myself to snap pictures as I'll be shooting some empty tables instead of a lively bar.
review 3: Sorry to say, but honestly said this is the best of the worst of modern P21 RGBA panels, they just couldn't hire a proper VJ (visual jockey). Absolutely awful and eye-torturing visualizer I ever seen.
review 4:
Everything was so amazing
Thanks for letting me through away my stressfull things in my head LOL...
review 5: Great bar with live music and dj

name: Sitara Indian Restaurant Denpasar
address: Jl. Teuku Umar No.137 B, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1: Indian food in this restaurant absolute delight for the senses! Whether you're savoring the creamy richness of butter chicken, the tangy goodness of tamarind-infused dishes, or the satisfying heat of a well-made curry, Indian food offers something for every palate. The diversity of regional specialties ensures there's always something new and exciting to try. Indian food is a true culinary adventure that leaves you craving more. Must visit and try
review 2: Had good Indian food in Bali..Met Sonia the owner who shared her experience and is managing the business very well as we see.Also she is very spiritual and knowledgeable that's why the food and ambience has a good and different flavor.
review 3: The food is delicious, but the restaurant needs renovation. Dirty ventilation and air conditioning, it's not good for breathing, the toilet stinks very much. Nice staff. Very tasty lamb, I recommend it
review 4: Wonderful day! Serving was great, very nice people who check up on you. Also the food was the most delicious Indian food I have eaten .. pani puri, naan & chhotey .it was a very good lunch and I really recommend eating here.
review 5: This is the best Indian food I have ever had. The service is excellent and the atmosphere is peaceful. I even asked the owner to build another restaurant closer to my house. I give this a definite 5-star review.

name: Warung Made
address: Jl. Pulau Ayu Selatan No.65, Pedungan, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80221, Indonesia

name: Sunda Kelapa
address: Jl. Teuku Umar No.189, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia
review 1:
the otak otak is so good ‚ù§Ô∏è
always come for the soto betawi soup!
this restaurant has been around for years! definitely family choice
review 2: One of the place that serves speciality dishes from Jakarta, Chinese foods, especially soto. The looks from inside gives old school vibes and nostalgia feeling. The foods was nice and the atmosphere was homey, not the mention the service was nice too. Looking forward to come again when have the chance.
review 3: Food here is great, always my go to spot for soto betawi. Closes at 11 pm so its really convenient for those who want to eat a late dinner
review 4: For many years I came here. Foods are delicious, service was great, atmosphere so perfect. If I missed my hometown (Jakarta), I always coming to Sunda Kelapa. So, for everyone, I am telling you, please come to Sunda Kelapa for your culinary experiences and try a different side of the Indonesian food. I‚Äôll give 9.7/10
review 5: Love their soto betawi, it might be the best classic soto betawi in town. The broth was so thick and flavorful, generous amount of meat. Definitely will come back to try their other menu.

name: Umah Kawan Pedungan
address: Jl. P. Bungin I No.14, Pedungan, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80222, Indonesia
review 1: Good place, Feel relax with Balinese local food Rujak n Tipat Cantok...Delicius taste
review 2: their bulung is so good! even when i ordered it online their taste is same! i also ordered rujak mangga serut and tipat cantok both are delicious. definitely a must try.
review 3:
According to its name Umah Kawan has meaning of a Friend's House.

Comfy and cozy! Just feeling like you're in a house, enjoying food and drinks that your friend serving for you ^^

From the picture is my most fav menu!

*Facilities
Wifi
Dining table
Music
Fish pond view
review 4: What a good place for nongkrong. ü§ù
review 5: One of my favorite warung rujak üòçüòçüòç

name: Sayang Residence 1
address: Jl. Pulau Sayang No.24, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80113, Indonesia
review 1: Room was very dirty! A lot of insect in the bathroom. The hot water was not good. I lived for a month and the electrical price was very expensive (separate from basic price). Not recommend! Their management has to improve a lot of things of this hotel.
review 2: Very poor service. Don't housekeeping service. Staff not friendly

name: Ikan Bakar dan Goreng Khas Jimbaran
address: Jl. Pulau Kawe No.57, Pedungan, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia
review 1:
The taste is worth for the price. Comfort dining table and clean.

Just not too like the location that is in the main road, so it's too crowded with a lot transportations and it's so noisy and hot, it's make me just try eating out here one time and choose to other location with the same price and same menu
review 2: the kerang bakar here is exquisite. it's so good that you forget about the sambal. the seasoning itself stands out on its own. what's great is also they have so many different meal options you can choose from. fish? shrimp? kerang? squid? all of the above? yas queen.
review 3:
A hidden gem.
Driving through Denpasar, being not familiar with the area, I‚Äôm always tempted to go for a safe option for lunch which usually a Babi gluing warung. But this time, I had some spare time before my next meeting so I spent a lil time to search through the area and found this grilled seafood warung.

The place was so dead, only one person was there dining isle and I‚Äôm pretty sure it was the owner üòÖ so I gambled and ordered a meal (PAKET L) which include a grilled whole fish, 6 clams, a few prawns, rice, water spinach and drink! And those things only cost 60k I‚Äôm pretty sure. So I added grilled tofu (not kerupuk lol) and then added extra iced tea during my meal. All and all only costed me 75k!! AMAZING! And the food was super yummy too!

Definitely recommend this joint!
review 4: The taste of the grilling sauce was quite nice, but there are a couple of things where I've found other reviews to be a tad misleading. Firstly, it's not that cheap; given the size of the fish you get is small in comparison to other places, it's just alright. The produce weren't as fresh and the squid was as hard as an eraser. The place had no exhaust nor an open grilling space so all the smoke gets into the dining area and you'll come out smelling like a grill.
review 5: Love the price and the taste, too bad limited parking space

name: The Orange Homestay
address: Jl. Pulau Ayu No.96, Pedungan, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia
review 1:
Not as pretty as their  promotional pictures. I was a bit disappointed.
I loved their brochure though.
review 2: Beautiful homestay, nice garden, and close to city
review 3: Its ok, private, Relax, tidy and clean.

name: V KOST
address: Jl. Pulau Ayu Sel. Gg. II No.100, Pedungan, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80222, Indonesia

name: Bakmi Akai
address: Jl. Teuku Umar No.186, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia
review 1: Visited in the morning (9am) as we thought they open early per google map. Placed order and waited pretty darn long for 3 bowls of noodles. The noodle texture is softer and resembles those Chinese bakmie I had in Bandung, West Java. Regardless of choice, you are served a bowl of noodle with meat sauce, quail egg, and strands of greens and what differs is the content of the soup (dumplings, prawns, etc ). Noodle taste was okay and the dumplings had more skins than content. They could definitely use more minced meat and the price wasn't exactly cheap here.
review 2: Taste is just okay. I like the consistency of the noodles, but with that small amount of topping? Totally overpriced.
review 3:
I don't know if this is truly a legend or not, but when I'm in Bali I always come here whenever I have a chance, and this time I don't forget to write a review lol. I love its noodle, wether it's boiled or fried. Dumpling is great too, with clear and tasty soup. Fair portion at moderate price. Place has fan only but not too hot. Limited parking lot.

Update (11/23):
It also sells groceries now. Flies is the biggest problem now.
review 4:
Well it's not legend.. Legend..
But it reminds you back to bakmi in the early 90's.

Too bad nowadays there are still far more better option to dine noodle in Bali.
review 5: This place is overrated. The taste overall is salty. And i think the owner have dog, can smell the stinky dog while eating üò±

name: D'Kubu Mandiri
address: Jl. Pulau Ayu Gg. XVII No.10A, Pedungan, Denpasar Selatan, Bali 80221, Indonesia

name: ACK Pulau Kawe
address: Jl. Pulau Kawe No.70x, Pedungan, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80222, Indonesia
review 1: This is the first time I have visited this place since the restaurant is open. The restaurant is really good. It is clean and has a lot of menus. I've attached the menu that you can use to choose before you are going to visit this place. However, in one of my chickens that I bought from here, there is a chicken that is still undercooked even if it is not fully undercooked, but it is still fine. Please ensure all chicken that is provided is perfectly cooked. Thanks

name: Kos Pondok Sari
address: Jl. P. Adi VI No.15 B, Pedungan, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia
review 1: Full.. I would love to see the inside and know how much per month tho.
review 2: Nice place and great environment, neat and comfy place

name: Kos 23
address: Gg. IV D No.23, Pedungan, Denpasar Selatan, Kota Denpasar, Bali 80114, Indonesia

name: Mauve Cafe
address: Jl. Teuku Umar No.200, Dauh Puri Kauh, Kec. Denpasar Bar., Kota Denpasar, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: Super cute aesthetic cafe. The staff working was very kind and patient. We tried three of the cookies and they were all delicious, the Brokie was our favourite. The value is great and we will definitely be back again to try the other flavours!
review 2:
The staff are very friendly and spoke english which is important to me as I‚Äôm not very fluent in Indonesian üòÖ

The food consists mainly of various flavours of cookies however my personal favourite is the red velvet cookie! The drinks are all great, I‚Äôll recommend the iced classic chocolate drink or the hot vanilla latte üò§üëç

Ultimately, I recommend coming here to chill, do some work, or catchup with friends/family as the atmosphere is great and there is free wifi!
review 3: Good coffee and baked cookie.. nice place also
review 4: Cute cafe hidden in denpasar area, selling soft cookies with different variants, recommended !
review 5: The best place to WFC (Work from Cafe)
